arts.ttl: U’s boss has say on Tyler Goodrham red card as ace faces three-game ban
arts.sum: GARY Rowett is unsure whether Oxford United will appeal the red card shown to Tyler Goodrham in the Emirates FA Cup third round defeat at Exeter City.

arts.ttl: Demetri Mitchell celebrates birthday in style with Exeter City FA Cup goals
arts.sum: But the Grecians rallied and two Mitchell goals put them ahead before half-time. Demetri Mitchell celebrated his 28 th birthday in style as he scored two goals to help Exeter City make some FA Cup history.

arts.ttl: Exeter City 3 Oxford United 1 - Grecians cause FA Cup upset and reach round four - Devon Live
arts.sum: Exeter City booked their spot in the fourth round of the FA Cup for the first time in 44 years after cruising past Oxford United. Oxford took the lead in the 14 th minute when Matt Phillips got on the end of the swift counter-attack to slot the finish home.

arts.ttl: FA Cup roundup: Forest revel in spirit of ‘59 against Luton as Exeter shock Oxford
arts.sum: Nottingham Forest beat Luton 2-0 in repeat of 1959 final Leicester thrash QPR 6-2 as Brighton ease past Norwich With their club legend, Mick Harford, helping to lead the team, Luton, who sacked manager Rob Edwards this week, travelled to Nottingham Forest for a repeat of 1959’s final. And just like that Wembley day, the Hatters departed in disappointment, losing 2-0 at the City Ground. Ryan Yates, the Forest captain, was the driving force for Nuno Espirito Santo’s team, and scored the first goal for the Premier League high-fliers, a stooping header after a fine cross from Ramón Sosa. The Paraguayan then scored Forest’s second himself, sliding in from close range after Jota Silva’s pass from the right wing to follow up six consecutive Premier League wins with a comfortable stroll into the next round. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Exeter shock Oxford to reach fourth round for first time in 44 years
arts.sum: League One side Exeter City reach the fourth round of the FA Cup for the first time in 44 years by upsetting Championship side Oxford United.

arts.ttl: Exeter stun Oxford to reach FA Cup fourth round for first time since 1981
arts.sum: Matt Phillips had put the Championship side ahead before League One Exeter hit back with birthday boy Demetri Mitchell netting a brace .

arts.ttl: Maik Nawrocki targeted for Celtic transfer exit as ambitious Oxford United make their move to pull off shock deal
arts.sum: The English Championship outfit want to land the Polish defender on-loan

arts.ttl: Exeter City know they need to do everything right for FA Cup progress
arts.sum: Exeter City must do everything right if they are to overcome the challenge of Championship side Oxford United in today’s FA Cup clash at St James Park and reach round four for the first time in 44 years. Not since the glorious run of 1980/81, in which Exeter reached the quarter-finals, have they progressed beyond round three, but against a team 17th in the Championship, there is a genuine feeling that the Grecians have been presented with a winnable tie.

arts.ttl: UPDATES: Exeter City v Oxford United – live
arts.sum: All the build-up, action and reaction as Oxford United begin their Emirates FA Cup campaign in the third round at Exeter City. After three wins and a draw in the first four league games under Gary Rowett, attention now turns to the FA Cup. Comment below or tweet @OxfordMailOUFC to get involved.

arts.ttl: Exeter City looking to make more FA Cup memories
arts.sum: Round four took them to top-flight Leicester City and after a 1-1 draw at Filbert Street, the Grecians won a breathtaking replay 3-1 beneath the St James Park floodlights, courtesy of the late, great Tony Kellow, who bagged a hat-trick that magical night. The Grecians have seen off National League Barnet 5-3 and Chesterfield 2-0 to reach the third round and with them lying 14th in the League One standings, then it does feel that the club can have a real crack at a Cup run.
